subject: Sleep
title: How Much Sleep Adults Really Need
description: A fast breakdown of How Much Sleep Adults Really Need for builders.

hook.text: Adults need seven to nine hours. Most get six and a half. The gap is slowly damaging their health.

buildup.text: Sleep need doesn't decrease much after age 25. The common belief that adults need less is a myth.

discovery.text: Adults who consistently sleep less than seven hours show measurable declines in cognition and immune function.

twist.text: Sleeping more than nine hours regularly is also associated with health risks and may signal underlying illness.

climax.text: The sweet spot is individual but falls in a narrow band. Most adults thrive between seven and eight hours.

punchline.text: Seven to nine hours isn't a suggestion. It's a prescription.

quiz.question: How much sleep do most adults need?
